quest.name: Trouble at Zenith
journal: Mogkul is worried about the invading dragons' intentions.

Mogkul is confused as to why dragons would be attacking them if their true intention was to destroy Zenith. Mogleo, having just recently joined the Pomguard, asks Mogkul why the dragons are loath to let the holy place stand. Mogkul explains that Zenith stands as a symbol of the once-strong friendship between the landlords and the skylords, and is all that remains standing after Nidhogg's wrath laid waste to the land. Mogleo surmises that the dragons are not aiming to destroy the whole tower, but the object that most symbolizes it: the spire. Mogkul and the others rush off towards the spire, and Mogkul commands Mogleo to stay put due to his wounds. Mogleo asks you to aid the Pomguard in defense of Zenith.

It seems Mogleo was correct, and upon arriving at the spire of Zenith you see the injured members of the Pomguard with a fearsome dragon flapping its wings menacingly above them. While the dragon is impressed that the moogles were able to survive thus far, it has no intention of letting anyone escape this time. It attacks, but you slay it as you have many dragons before it. Check on the grounded members of the Pomguard to ensure that their wounds are not severe.

The moogles seem to recover from their battle relatively quickly, and are filled with pride that Zenith still stands unharmed. The moogles say that they will continue to honor their sacred covenant with Hraesvelgr, but express regret that they lack the means to do anything more than patrol the palace and clean up the occasional minor mess. However, the moogles are proud of their accomplishment this day, and Mogkul states they will perform one final patrol of Zenith to ensure that there are no more dragons wandering about. Return to Moghome and tell Captain Mogloo about his troops' heroic deeds.

Mogloo is grateful that you were able to assist the Pomguard in protecting Zenith, and proud that they were able to save it from disaster. Echoing Mogkul's sentiment, Mogloo wishes that the moogles could do something to repair the damage Zenith suffers as the years pass. However, until the day arrives when the moogles learn the required skills, they will dutifully continue their patrol and cleaning duties.

dialogue.name: MOGOK
dialogue.text: We've finished our patrols, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGGA
dialogue.text: I think we scared all the dragons away, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGLEO
dialogue.text: I'll be okay...but I should lie down for a bit, kupo...

dialogue.name: MOGKUL
dialogue.text: Mogok and Mogga have given me their reports! Adventurer, tell me what you saw while patrolling through Zenith, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGKUL
dialogue.text: Hmmm... As I thought, Nidhogg's minions were already in Zenith. But if their aim was to destroy it, then why haven't they done anything more? Were they just here to attack us?

dialogue.name: MOGLEO
dialogue.text: Mogkul, why do these dragons wish to destroy Zenith, kupo?

dialogue.name: MOGKUL
dialogue.text: Ah, Mogleo, you've just joined the Pomguard, so we haven't had time to tell you the whole story.

dialogue.name: MOGKUL
dialogue.text: A thousand years ago, when the skylords and landlords lived together in peace, they built this palace to stand as a symbol of their friendship.

dialogue.name: MOGKUL
dialogue.text: But as you know, war broke out between them, and Nidhogg and his servants wrought destruction upon the landlords. Of the structures that the landlords built, only this palace, so loved by the great wyrm Hraesvelgr, remains.

dialogue.name: MOGLEO
dialogue.text: A symbol of friendship... If they can't bring down the whole tower, they must mean to destroy its most symbolic part, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGKUL
dialogue.text: Its most symbolic part...that couldn't mean...

dialogue.name: MOGKUL
dialogue.text: Oh no, kupopo! They mean to destroy the spire!

dialogue.name: MOGKUL
dialogue.text: The spire is right above us. Mogok, Mogga─the two of you come with me! Mogleo, you still need rest. Remain here, and stay out of sight of errant dragons, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGLEO
dialogue.text: W-Wait! Oh, I feel so useless, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGLEO
dialogue.text: Well, I may not be able to help, but you're here, kupo! You must help the others in my stead! Follow them and protect the spire, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGLEO
dialogue.text: Please help the others! Don't let the dragons bespoil Zenith, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGKUL
dialogue.text: We...we didn't stand a chance, kupo...

dialogue.name: MOGOK
dialogue.text: Too...strong...kupo...

dialogue.name: MOGGA
dialogue.text: I'm too pretty to die, kupo...

dialogue.name: DEATHGAZEDRAGON01868
dialogue.text: Ah, so you've brought a member of mankind to fight alongside you? You have done well to survive the attacks of my minions.

dialogue.name: DEATHGAZEDRAGON01868
dialogue.text: But where they failed, I shall succeed. Your corpses will fill my belly as the last remnants of mankind burn before me!

dialogue.name: MOGLEO
dialogue.text: I knew you would make it back, kupo! Next time, my own strength will not falter.

dialogue.name: MOGOK
dialogue.text: I've never faced a dragon so strong... Thank the heavens you were with us, adventurer!

dialogue.name: MOGGA
dialogue.text: I made it through with naught but a crooked pom. And it's all thanks to you, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGKUL
dialogue.text: Such a dreadful dragon─but you gave it the thrashing of a lifetime! Their plan lies in a shambles, and Zenith stands proud, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGGA
dialogue.text: Zenith is safe! Those dragons'll think twice before coming here again, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGGA
dialogue.text: At last, we can finally rest our wings. We've barely had time to stop and look at what we're protecting, but now that we do... Is there a sight as breathtaking, kupo?

dialogue.name: MOGKUL
dialogue.text: Aye, its beauty is unrivaled. Alas, time has not been kind to it...

dialogue.name: MOGGA
dialogue.text: Every day, the cracks run longer and more bricks come loose. And there's little we can do to stay the ravages of time. I often wonder if Hraesvelgr is saddened by the sight, kupo.

dialogue.name: MOGOK
dialogue.text: It is not for us to know the great wyrm's feelings. What matters is that we honor the covenant and continue keeping Zenith clean and safe.

dialogue.name: MOGKUL
dialogue.text: Yes, the covenant our ancestors formed with the great wyrm Hraesvelgr.

dialogue.name: MOGKUL
dialogue.text: We protect his precious memories, and in return, he protects us.

dialogue.name: MOGKUL
dialogue.text: The great Hraesvelgr has suffered the sting of betrayal once already, and we shall not be the ones to betray him again. Until the day clouds of sorrow blot the skies no longer, we shall remain true to him.

dialogue.name: MOGKUL
dialogue.text: Oh, kupopo! Are you crying, adventurer? Our apologies─we didn't mean to get so sentimental.

dialogue.name: MOGKUL
dialogue.text: Worry not, this isn't a time for sadness! Cheer up, because thanks to you, the Pomguard has the courage to be even better, kupo!

dialogue.name: MOGKUL
dialogue.text: We'll patrol Zenith one more time to make sure no more nasty dragons are lurking about. Pray return to Moghome and tell Captain Mogloo of our valiant deeds here!

dialogue.name: MOGLEO
dialogue.text: The spire is safe, and the Pomguard unharmed!? Thank you, adventurer!

dialogue.name: MOGLOO
dialogue.text: ...A fearsome dragon at Zenith!? I dread to think what might have happened had you not been on hand. My thanks for your aid, adventurer!

dialogue.name: MOGLOO
dialogue.text: It is as Mogok says. Come what may, we will continue to honor the sacred covenant with Hraesvelgr, kupo.

dialogue.name: MOGLOO
dialogue.text: Would that we could do more. Had we but the knowledge, we would restore Zenith to its former glory.

dialogue.name: MOGLOO
dialogue.text: But we haven't, and it avails us naught to dwell on what we cannot do. Nay, we must focus our energies on what we can do─that is, protecting Zenith. My moogles have performed their duty most admirably this day, and they shall be rewarded─with kupo nuts!
